name: Maui Kai

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay - small, but friendly. Loved the mornings watching whales from our balcony. One whale did a full breach right in front of us - awesome. We had a wonderful 12 days in unit #406 - did lots of relaxing, laying in the sun, swimming, snorkeling. Best vacation ever. We'll definitely be back to Maui Kai. If you want a big resort with fancy dining & lots to do - this probably isn't the place. But Maui Kai is friendly, quiet; parking is close; no condo is more than about a 10 second walk from the elevator; ocean view from EVERY unit; swimming & snorkeling 5-10 steps from the patio; convenient to Lahaina & Ka'anapali shopping

reviews.title: Maui Kai 301
reviews.text: Our favorite places to eat - Bubba Gumps & Alexander's Fish & Chips - both in Lahaina.

reviews.title: MauiKai-504 The ultimite spot
reviews.text: Don't miss the trip up Haleakala - one of my favorite places on earth. The road to Hana was fun. Sceenery beyond Hana is beautiful. Small narrow road, but worth the drive. Also enjoy driving around the north side of the island.

reviews.title: Maui Kai Unit #301...a fabulous view!
reviews.text: We were very impressed with the view and amenities of the Maui Kai 301. The whale watching was fabulous! The unit was very comfortable and we will definitely be back.

reviews.title: Phenominal is an understatement
reviews.text: We can't beleive we're back in Montreal already.

reviews.title: Beautiful Sunsets
reviews.text: You can't ask for a better location to enjoy beautiful Maui sunsets. The Maui Kai literally sits at the water's edge. The staff is always very friendly and the facility and grounds are impeccably kept. Unit 504 has everything you need to make your getaway relaxing and hassle free. The furnishings are attractive and the unit is completely stocked with all of your vacation incidentals (garbage bags,coffee filters, cooking utensils, etc.) We have rented many condominiums at various places and I must say that this unit and the Magorno's made it one of our more pleasureable experiences.
We (2 adults, 2 children) booked this condo based on reviews on this site. It turned out to be a overall enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Our Maui Stay
Loved Unit 201!
reviews.text: We were in #1004, which we went to the room with trepidation based on a previous web comment here. We were relieved that in our opinion it wasn't as bad as they had thought.

reviews.title: Great Condo and location
reviews.text: This unit's comments I would break down into two parts.

reviews.title: Perfect Location
reviews.text: The worst part (1) was the kitchen/batheroom cupboard doors are old & at the end of their life span. Contents of the cupboards were overflowing with utensils of all sorts. If you plan to spend lots of time cooking, this room might not be for you if you want nice doors.

Before I start, I have to chuckle at the picture of the building above. From that angle it looks as if the condo sits all by itself on a stretch of beach. In fact, the Mahana is about 10 feet away on one side and the Embassy Suites is about 10 feet away on the other. Not that this was a problem but you have to hand it to the marketing dept.
reviews.title: Good location, great value
Maui Kai #504
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights in unit 908, which is a one bedroom corner unit on the 9th floor. We booked through mauikai.com and not directly with an owner. When you book through the resort they will guarantee the unit type but not the exact unit.

The building in directly on the beach, just north of Kaanapali. The beach itself is nice but the water is loaded with rock so the you need reef shoes of some sort to swim here. The snorkeling was pretty good. Kaanapali beach is about 2 miles south. It's a little more sandy but still quite a bit of rock. We spent a couple of days there on the stretch of beach in front of the mega resorts (Hyatt, Marriott, Westin, Sheraton, others). We found that most people preferred to crowd in the pool area and the beach was quite secluded.
reviews.title: Maui Kai was great

reviews.text: We were happy with our unit. The decor/furniture was a mix of old and new. The carpet, tv and kitchen cabinets appeared to be very new while some furniture seemed much older. Everything appeared clean and well kept however. The unit was stocked with everything you could need for 5 days: silverware, every conceivable cooking utensil, blender, toaster, microwave etc.. We also found snorkeling gear, some board games and books if you need to entertain yourself for some reason. There was a big safe in the bedroom which made it easier not to drag valuables to the beach. Each unit has a good size lanai that practically hangs over the ocean. When you book directly with maui kai, it includes daily housekeeping.
reviews.title: Maui Kai #306
Great Condo and Stunning view
reviews.text: The pool area is small but includes a hot tub and a nice clubhouse. There are 2 gas grills and a kitchen there for everyone's use. There was also a computer with internet access. The pool area is sheltered and doesn't get much sun. There is a bar at the pool next door at the Embassy Suites. Decent frozen drinks.

reviews.title: Loved #301
reviews.text: Our favorite part was the lanai! We spent extra special time enjoying the ocean and each other. We slept out there each night and woke up to the waves, had our coffee, and spent quality time together. We couldn't have asked for more; a convenient location on Maui, a private place to enjoy our honeymoon, and all of the conveniences of home. All this with a front row seat to the wonders of the ocean!

description: Maui Kai features all oceanfront junior suite (studio), one bedroom and two bedroom accommodations. Daily towel service, weekly maid service, in-room safe, local phone calls, high speed internet cable hook up, wi-fi also in each room and at the pool and cabana area are all complimentary with no additional fees. Free parking. All rooms have central air conditioning, DVR's, DVD players with freee current release DVD's and spectacular sunsets. Heated pool, jacuzzi, barbecues, and laundry facilities all on site. Located on northern Kaanapali Beach, just four miles north of Lahaina.
